messages.text: Hey, can you come home early?
Like, now?
Wellâ€¦itâ€™s important.
Sarah, I have a big meeting todayâ€”
But Iâ€™ll cancel it and come home if you need me.
Youâ€™re going to be my wife.
I want to be there for you.
Thanks Rob. Thatâ€™s really sweet. ðŸ˜˜
And because youâ€™re going to be my husband, I want to be honest with you.
I AM really worried about somethingâ€¦
two minutes later
Rob?
I mean, I guess it can wait until the end of the dayâ€¦
Canâ€™t you tell me over text?
No, Iâ€™d rather do it in person.
Itâ€™s too important.
Iâ€™m coming home.
If itâ€™s too important for textâ€”
Then itâ€™s important enough for me to cancel the meeting to be with you.
Rob, thank you. Seriously.
twenty minutes later
Where are you?
I just got home and youâ€™re not here.
OMG, wait. Are you okay??!
Iâ€™m okay. Iâ€™m on my way back from the store.
Sarah, are you KIDDING me?!
I cancelled an important meeting to come home to you.
I canâ€™t believe youâ€™d just leave like that.
Sarah??
Ten minutes later, Sarah pulls into her parking spot at the apartment complex.
She and Rob bought a place there three months ago, right after they got engaged.
When Robert sees her get out of the car, carrying a plastic bag, he throws open the door, yelling.
What is going on?!
You SERIOUSLY thought it was a good time to go shopping right now??
Can we please do this inside, Rob?
You know whatâ€”NO.
By putting you first today, I could get in huge trouble at my job.
I think itâ€™s fair for you to put me first now.
Fine.
With that, Sarah throws the plastic bag at Robertâ€™s chest.
He looks inside and, as the color runs out of his face,
He starts to whisper, almost reverently.
Is this a pregnancy test??
Yes.
Are youâ€¦??
I donâ€™t know. Can we go inside to talk about it?
I want to keep it private.
Rob nods numbly and lets Sarah guide him into the apartment.
Youâ€™reâ€¦ youâ€™re going to have a baby?
Well, we donâ€™t know that for sure.
I mean, thatâ€™s why I got the pregnancy test.
Sarah, Iâ€¦
I REALLY want this to be real.
I know Iâ€™m getting ahead of myselfâ€”
But what if itâ€™s a girl with your smile??
Rob, stop.
This is a lot for me to handle right now.
Weâ€™re not even married.
But the weddingâ€™s in six months!
Weâ€™re GETTING married.
And itâ€™s so beautiful that weâ€™re already starting a family.
I WANT to have a family with you.
Rob, slow down. One step at a time.
Letâ€™s see if weâ€™re actually pregnant first.
Okay.
Want me to come in the bathroom with you?
Ew, Rob! NO.
But you can hold my hand afterâ€¦
When we have to wait the three minutes for the result.
Okay. Anything I can do to help.
Thanks for coming home.
Of course. Youâ€™re going to be my wife.
Sarah goes into the bathroom, and when she comes out her hands are shaking.
Robert takes the pregnancy test from her and places it on the counter.
Then he presses a button on his cellphone, and music fills the room.
Itâ€™s THINKING OUT LOUD by Ed Sheeranâ€”the song they chose for their wedding dance.
Sarah?
Iâ€™ll sit and hold your hands while we wait if you wantâ€¦
But instead, why donâ€™t we dance?
Tears fill Sarahâ€™s eyes, and suddenly, she canâ€™t speak without cryingâ€¦
So she just nods her head. Robert starts singing low, right into her ear.
When your legs don't work like they used to beforeâ€¦
And I can't sweep you off of your feetâ€¦
When one of Sarahâ€™s teardrops falls on Robertâ€™s shoulder,
He pulls back to look in her eyes.
Whatâ€™s wrong?
Iâ€™m just so scared.
I mean, I want to keep the baby if the test is positiveâ€¦
But we had this whole perfect wedding planned.
Our parents put down so much moneyâ€¦
WE put down so much moneyâ€¦
And now, with the pregnancy, it might not be perfect anymore.
What do you mean?
Itâ€™ll still be us, getting married to each other.
Iâ€™ll still get to marry the girl of my dreams.
Yes, but the girl of your dreams is going to look fat in her wedding dress.
What?
Pregnancy kind of changes a womanâ€™s body, Robâ€¦
Yeah I know, but that doesnâ€™t mean youâ€™ll look fat.
Youâ€™ll be glowing.
And youâ€™ll be carrying my child.
Sare, youâ€™ll look beautifulâ€”itâ€™s not possible for you to look another way.
But I wonâ€™t be able to drink at our wedding!
Haha, please. I know youâ€”and I know that doesnâ€™t really matter to you.
Not when it means youâ€™ll get a brilliant, gorgeous baby in exchange.
Thatâ€™s true.
And she could have your eyesâ€¦
Ahh, so you think sheâ€™s a girl too?
Nah, heâ€™s definitely a boyâ€¦ I just didnâ€™t want to hurt your feelings.
Haha, thereâ€™s my fiancÃ©eâ€”youâ€™re getting your sense of humor back.
Iâ€™m trying, anyway.
Just then, the song ends.
Does that meanâ€¦?
Yeah. Are you ready to look?
Ready as Iâ€™ll ever be.
Okayâ€¦
Robert reaches for the test.
Wait!
What?
Letâ€™s count down from three.
Okay. Oneâ€¦
Twoâ€¦
Three!
He flips the test over and when they see the positive sign,
They donâ€™t say a word. Robert just wraps Sarah into a hug.
And this time, Sarah doesnâ€™t cryâ€¦joy takes over and she starts to laugh.
The laughter is contagious. It spills over her and into Robert,
And soon theyâ€™re laughing in each otherâ€™s arms.
Weâ€™re going to have a baby!
I knowâ€”itâ€™s a miracle.
YOUâ€™RE a miracle.
Robert grasps Sarahâ€™s face between his palms and gives her a hard, passionate kiss.
When they pull back, Sarah looks deeply into Robertâ€™s eyes.
Rob?
I have an idea.
Instead of throwing this big expensive weddingâ€¦
Instead of shoving my pregnant body into a wedding dressâ€¦
Can we cancel everything and have a small ceremony?
What? Are you sure?
You wanted a big wedding.
I did. But I donâ€™t anymore.
Now I want a family.
And I want to always put it first, just like you always doâ€¦
From now until the day I die.
